objectclass.name: zimbraAccount
objectclass.comment:
zimbraAccount extends zimbraMailRecipient. It represents a real account in the system (either admin or end-user) that can be logged into, etc.
It is defined as AUXILIARY in case it needs to be mixed to an existing directory deployment.
cn - full name, common name co - country friendly name company - company (company name) displayName - name to display in admin tool, outlook uses as well (cn is multi-valued) gn - first name (given name) initials - middle initial l - city (locality) ou - organizational unit physicalDeliveryOfficeName - office street - street address postalCode - zip code sn - last name (sir name) st - state telephoneNumber - phone

objectclass.name: zimbraCOS
objectclass.comment: zimbraCOS is the class of service object. it should have attributes that are used as default values for accounts that belong to the COS and do not have the same attribute defined in the account directory entry.

objectclass.name: zimbraDomain
objectclass.comment: zimbraDomain is used to represent a domain in the directory. For example, if we created the foo.com domain, then the dc=foo,dc=com entry in LDAP would have an objectclass of zimbraDomain. domain-specific configuration information (if so-needed) could be added here.

objectclass.name: zimbraSecurityGroup
objectclass.comment: zimbraSecurityGroup is used to represent a security group in the directory. Members of this group have a zimbraMemberOf attr with this group's zimbraId. If this group is a member of other groups, then it will have those group's zimbraIds in its own zimbraMemberOf list.

objectclass.name: zimbraDistributionList
objectclass.comment: zimbraDistributionList represents a distribution/mailing list. It inherits from zimbraMailRecipient. Members (who can be internal/external) are represented as zimbraMailForwardingAddress attrs.

objectclass.name: zimbraMailRecipient
objectclass.comment: zimbraMailRecipient is used to represent entries in the directory that can receive mail. i.e., they have a visible external address, that gets expanded into one or more internal/external addresses.

objectclass.name: zimbraServer
objectclass.comment: zimbraServer is used to represent a defined server within a zimbra install. server-specific configuration information will be added here. This includes information like which services should be running on a server, whether or not the server is normally a master/slave, etc.

objectclass.name: zimbraGlobalConfig
objectclass.comment: zimbraGlobalConfig is the entry that holds all the global configuration attrs.

objectclass.name: zimbraAlias
objectclass.desc: An alias to another zimbra object
objectclass.comment: zimbraAlias is used to privision aliases

objectclass.name: zimbraMimeEntry
objectclass.comment: zimbraMimeEntry is used to represent status about mime types

objectclass.name: zimbraObjectEntry
objectclass.comment: zimbraObjectEntry is used to represent status about object types

objectclass.name: zimbraTimeZone
objectclass.comment: zimbraTimeZone is used to define a timezone with daylight savings time rules. Used in calendar.

objectclass.name: zimbraZimletEntry
objectclass.comment: zimbraZimletEntry is used to represent Zimlets

objectclass.name: zimbraCalendarResource
objectclass.comment: zimbraCalendarResource is used to represent a calendar resource This objectclass should be mixed in to a zimbraAccount entry.

objectclass.name: zimbraIdentity
objectclass.comment: zimbraIdentity is the account identity object, which stores information about Email "identities"

objectclass.name: zimbraDataSource
objectclass.desc: base class for data source objects
objectclass.comment: zimbraDataSource is the base class for data source objects

objectclass.name: zimbraPop3DataSource
objectclass.comment: zimbraPop3DataSource is the base class for POP3 data source objects

objectclass.name: zimbraImapDataSource
objectclass.comment: zimbraImapDataSource is the base class for IMAP data source objects

objectclass.name: zimbraSignature
objectclass.comment: zimbraSignature is the account Signature object, which stores information about Email "signatures"

objectclass.name: zimbraXMPPComponent
objectclass.comment: zimbraXMPPComponent defines information about routable XMPP services such as conference rooms, file transfer servies, etc

objectclass.name: zimbraAclTarget
objectclass.comment: target entries on which rights(acl) can be granted

objectclass.name: zimbraRssDataSource
objectclass.comment: Represents an RSS data source.

objectclass.name: zimbraLiveDataSource
objectclass.comment: Represents a Hotmail data source.

objectclass.name: zimbraGalDataSource
objectclass.comment: Represents a GAL data source.

objectclass.name: zimbraGroupMail
objectclass.desc: AUX oc to hold mail attributes for dynamic groups
objectclass.comment: AUX oc to hold mail attributes for dynamic groups
